concept.title: Maps and builds
concept.shortdesc: Maps point to topics that are included in output processing. You can use maps to specify a set of topics to transform at the same time, instead of transforming each topic individually.

conbody.p: Using maps makes it easier to select and manage the topics you want to process, and also makes the processing itself much faster.

Topics are processed, included in the output, or ignored based on how the map references them. Local references are included in the output, and processed unless their format is something other than DITA. References outside the current component (to peer components or external information sets) are included in output from the map (such as navigation panes and links), but aren't accessed or copied to the output directory.
